div.p: Most significant turning point has been having a mental breakdown and realising that no longer could I hide away from fears
and insecurities that I’d masked with alcoholism and other forms of addiction in the past and that to get on and live a, I was going to say
decent life, but a life rather than being shackled by these former self-healing solutions to go on and move to do a normal life
or what I perceived as a normal life is possible because there were some stages where I didn’t think it was possible
I didn’t think I should be here any more so...
I would say at any stage to take advice and listen to it but don’t let it hold you back from anything you want to do
if you want to do something and you have a passion, especially, for doing it try it, if you fail you fail but it won’t be an issue if you fail.
I think failure unfortunately is discouraged a great deal and failure is actually the only way people can learn.
